Art. 4.83. Obligation to report 
Without prejudice to paragraph 2, sub-paragraph 2, and to articles 4.254 to 4.259, any heir in the direct descending line who comes to the succession, even if he accepts under benefit of inventory, must report to his coheirs everything he has received from the deceased, by gift or by will, directly or indirectly, unless the gifts and legacies have been, in a certain manner, exempted from report.
A gift is also exempt from reporting if it is made out of share or precipitately.
By way of derogation from paragraph 1, universal legacies and legacies by universal title are presumed to be exempt from payment in kind, unless they have definitely been stipulated as being subject to payment in kind.
Liberalities made to the surviving spouse or to the surviving legal cohabitant are not liable to be reported.
Neither the surviving spouse nor the surviving legal cohabitant may demand the distribution of gifts made to other heirs, whether such gifts are subject to distribution among the other heirs or are exempt from distribution.
A relative who comes to the succession and who is not an heir in the direct descending line does not have to report what he has received from the deceased, by gift or by will, directly or indirectly, unless the report has been stipulated with certainty.
 A donee who was not a presumptive heir at the time of the gift, but who is an heir on the day of the opening of the succession, must also pay the inheritance, under the conditions defined in this article.
